intro: Capsicum annuum var. minus, commonly known as the dwarf bell pepper, is a compact variety of the common chili pepper. It is characterized by its small, round fruits that typically measure around 2–3 inches in diameter. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as for its mild, sweet flavor. The plant has a bushy growth habit with short stems and broad leaves. It thrives in warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
